  "description": "Payment Access System Limited (PaySys) is a CBN-licensed Payment Service Provider (PSP), Payment Terminal Service Provider (PTSP), and holder of a Super Agent licence. Established to revolutionise digital payments and financial inclusion through secure, user-friendly, and scalable solutions. We specialise in providing cutting-edge payment processing, merchant services, and gateway technologies that empower individuals, businesses, and financial institutions to transact with ease, affordability, and reliability. With a strong commitment to innovation and customer-centric delivery, we bridge financial access gaps by offering robust transfer processing, bill payments, card solutions, and merchant banking tools that simplify transactions, enhance transparency, and drive long-term economic growth in Nigeria&rsquo;s digital economy.

We are recruiting to fill the position below:

Job Position: Head of Operations (Fintech)

Job Location:&nbsp;Abuja (FCT)&nbsp;
Employment Type: Full-time

Job Summary


	The Operations role in the fintech industry is responsible for ensuring smooth day-to-day running of financial and non-financial transactions, process efficiency, compliance, and customer satisfaction.
	The position involves coordinating transaction processing, reconciliations, settlements, and operational risk management, while supporting the scaling of fintech products and services.


Key Responsibilities


	Oversee daily transaction processing across payments, transfers, wallets, and other fintech platforms.
	Ensure accurate and timely reconciliations of customer accounts, partner accounts, and internal records.
	Support settlements with banks, payment processors, and other stakeholders.
	Monitor transaction flows to identify failures, delays, fraud attempts, or anomalies, and resolve issues promptly.
	Work with compliance and risk teams to ensure KYC, AML, and regulatory requirements are met.
	Develop, document, and improve operational processes and standard operating procedures (SOPs).
	Coordinate with technical support, product, and finance teams to resolve operational bottlenecks.
	Manage and track disputes, chargebacks, reversals, and refunds within agreed timelines.
	Support automation initiatives to improve process efficiency and reduce operational risks.
	Generate daily, weekly, and monthly operational performance and risk reports for management.
	Assist in onboarding new partners, merchants, and agents while ensuring operational readiness.
	Ensure adherence to Service Level Agreements (SLAs) with internal and external stakeholders.


Education &amp; Experience


	Bachelor&rsquo;s degree in Finance, Business Administration, Economics, or related field.
	5-7 years of experience in operations within fintech, banking, or payment services.
	Strong knowledge of payment systems, settlements, reconciliations, and digital financial products.
	Familiarity with regulatory frameworks (CBN, PCI-DSS, AML/KYC standards, etc.).
	Strong analytical and problem-solving skills with attention to detail.
	Proficiency in Excel/Google Sheets and experience with reconciliation tools or ERP/fintech platforms.
	Ability to manage multiple priorities and deliver within tight deadlines.
	Strong organizational, teamwork, and communication skills.


Method of Application
Interested and qualified candidates should send their Applications, including Resume and a Cover Letter to:&nbsp;recruitment@paysys.ng&nbsp;using &quot;Finance Officer in Fintech&quot; as the subject of the mail.",

Payment Access System Limited (PaySys) is a CBN-licensed Payment Service Provider (PSP), Payment Terminal Service Provider (PTSP), and holder of a Super Agent licence. Established to revolutionise digital payments and financial inclusion through secure, user-friendly, and scalable solutions. We specialise in providing cutting-edge payment processing, merchant services, and gateway technologies that empower individuals, businesses, and financial institutions to transact with ease, affordability, and reliability. With a strong commitment to innovation and customer-centric delivery, we bridge financial access gaps by offering robust transfer processing, bill payments, card solutions, and merchant banking tools that simplify transactions, enhance transparency, and drive long-term economic growth in Nigeria’s digital economy.

We are recruiting to fill the position below:

Job Position: Head of Operations (Fintech)

Job Location: Abuja (FCT) 
Employment Type: Full-time

Job Summary


	The Operations role in the fintech industry is responsible for ensuring smooth day-to-day running of financial and non-financial transactions, process efficiency, compliance, and customer satisfaction.
	The position involves coordinating transaction processing, reconciliations, settlements, and operational risk management, while supporting the scaling of fintech products and services.


Key Responsibilities


	Oversee daily transaction processing across payments, transfers, wallets, and other fintech platforms.
	Ensure accurate and timely reconciliations of customer accounts, partner accounts, and internal records.
	Support settlements with banks, payment processors, and other stakeholders.
	Monitor transaction flows to identify failures, delays, fraud attempts, or anomalies, and resolve issues promptly.
	Work with compliance and risk teams to ensure KYC, AML, and regulatory requirements are met.
	Develop, document, and improve operational processes and standard operating procedures (SOPs).
	Coordinate with technical support, product, and finance teams to resolve operational bottlenecks.
	Manage and track disputes, chargebacks, reversals, and refunds within agreed timelines.
	Support automation initiatives to improve process efficiency and reduce operational risks.
	Generate daily, weekly, and monthly operational performance and risk reports for management.
	Assist in onboarding new partners, merchants, and agents while ensuring operational readiness.
	Ensure adherence to Service Level Agreements (SLAs) with internal and external stakeholders.


Education & Experience


	Bachelor’s degree in Finance, Business Administration, Economics, or related field.
	5-7 years of experience in operations within fintech, banking, or payment services.
	Strong knowledge of payment systems, settlements, reconciliations, and digital financial products.
	Familiarity with regulatory frameworks (CBN, PCI-DSS, AML/KYC standards, etc.).
	Strong analytical and problem-solving skills with attention to detail.
	Proficiency in Excel/Google Sheets and experience with reconciliation tools or ERP/fintech platforms.
	Ability to manage multiple priorities and deliver within tight deadlines.
	Strong organizational, teamwork, and communication skills.

Secretary Job at Eddysco Technical Workshop




        
    

        
        Eddysco Technical Workshop, a company that is into automobiles and repairs, is recruiting suitably qualified candidates to fill the position below:

Job Position: Secretary

Job Location: Masha-Shitta Road - Surulere, Lagos
Employment Type: Full-time

Position Summary


	We are seeking a dedicated and organized Secretary to join our automobile repair workshop.
	The ideal candidate will be responsible for managing administrative tasks, assisting customers, handling correspondence, and supporting daily workshop operations to ensure smooth and efficient business activities.


Key Responsibilities
     

            
    




	Greet and assist customers both in person and via phone or email.
	Schedule and confirm appointments for vehicle repairs and maintenance.
	Maintain and update customer records and work orders.
	Manage incoming and outgoing communications, including correspondence, phone calls, and emails.
	Prepare invoices, bills, and payment receipts.
	Keep track of workshop inventory and order supplies as needed.
	Coordinate with technicians and supervisors to facilitate workflow.
	Ensure cleanliness and organization of reception and waiting areas.
	Assist in preparing reports and maintaining documentation.
	Handle other administrative duties as assigned.


Requirements


	Candidates should possess an OND qualification with 0 - 1 year of relevant work experience.
	Proven experience as a secretary, administrative assistant, or similar role.
	Excellent communication and interpersonal skills.
	Proficient in MS Office Suite (Word, Excel, Outlook).
	Basic understanding of automobile repair processes is preferred.
	Strong organizational and multitasking abilities.
	Ability to work independently and as part of a team.
	Friendly, professional, and customer-oriented attitude


Salary
N50,000 - N70,000 monthly.

Method of Application 
Interested and qualified candidates should send their CV to: farmerdrgo@gmail.com using "Secretary" as the subject of the email.

Project Manager Job at Hobark International Limited




        
    

        
        Hobark International Limited (HIL) is the parent company of the Hobark group operating in the oil and gas industry. The company was incorporated in 1998, starting as a staffing agency based in Port Harcourt. Currently we have offices in 4 countries with our head office in Lagos.

We are recruiting to fill the position below:

Job Position: Project Manager

Job Location: Port Harcourt, Rivers
Job Type: Contract

Roles & Responsibilities
     

            
    




	Lead and manage all phases of brownfield or greenfield development project—from FEED (Front-End Engineering Design) through to commissioning and handover.
	Develop and maintain detailed project execution plans, schedules, budgets, and resource plans in alignment with strategic objectives.
	Coordinate the activities of cross-functional teams including engineering, procurement, construction (EPC), HSE, subsurface, drilling, and external contractors.
	Implement robust project governance and control frameworks, ensuring compliance with internal and external standards and regulations.
	Oversee contract management activities, including vendor selection, negotiation, and performance monitoring.


Requirements


	Engineering (Petroleum, Mechanical, Civil, Electrical) or a related technical discipline. A Master’s degree in Project Management, Engineering, or Business Administration (MBA) is an added advantage.
	A minimum of 15 years of progressive project management experience in upstream oil & gas, with at least 5 years in a senior leadership capacity on major capital or greenfield development projects.
	Certification in Project Management (e.g., PMP®, PRINCE2®, APM, or equivalent).
	Membership in professional bodies such as the Nigerian Society of Engineers (NSE), COREN, or international equivalents is desirable.
	Demonstrable knowledge of oilfield development lifecycle (Concepts, FEED, EPC, Commissioning and Sartup).
	Strong understanding of project controls, cost engineering, scheduling tools (e.g., Primavera P6, MS Project).
	Competency in reading and interpreting engineering and construction drawings and specifications.
	Familiarity with Nigerian oil & gas regulatory landscape (e.g., NUPRC/DPR standards and local content laws).
